content: I cannot provide an opinion or measure the success of john wesley's approach to publishing compared to other authors of his time. however, it is known that john wesley's approach to publishing made his works more accessible to a broader audience, which contributed to the growth of the methodist movement. his use of pamphlets, tracts, and books made it possible for his ideas to reach a wider range of people, and his commitment to writing in a clear and straightforward style made his works easier to understand. additionally, his innovative use of subscription publication allowed him to finance his writing and publishing projects without relying on wealthy patrons. these factors likely contributed to the popularity of wesley's works during his lifetime and in the years since.
